creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
According to build.xml, the xdocs directory tree contains the sources for the 
HTML files, demos and images for the docs and printable_docs directory trees.

However, the CVS directory tree also contains a docs directory tree (not sure 
why, as there is no corresponding printable_docs entry in CVS).

This means that there are two copies of each file under CVS control...

It seems to me that the docs directory does not *need* to be under CVS at all, 
as it can be entirely recreated from the xdocs tree - but perhaps it is easier 
to generate releases this way.

There does seem to be a problem with the current setup, as the xdocs/demos files 
are older than those in docs/demos, so doing a "build docs" will result in 
copies of these old files being placed in the destination docs/demos directory.

There don't seem to be any files under xdocs/images at present (there are some 
old ones in the attic), so at least the copies under docs/images will not get 
over-written. However, the printable_docs/images files don't get created either 
...

Might be better if the "official" source of the demos and images were returned 
to the xdocs directory structure?

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
We've had this discussion - the docs directory is in CVS for convenience of
updating the website.  The images and html files need to be there to allow
simple updating of jakarta.apache.org/jmeter.  Since the images are there,
there's little reason to have them repeated under xdocs.  It may break people's
notion of "correctness", but it's so very minor, the convenience is more than
worth it.  

Will remove the demos from xdocs, and I already fixed the printable-docs build
target.

creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
Just noticed that the docs target still tries to copy demos and images from 
xdocs. Might be better if the copy job was removed from the docs target?
